We have already supported TLS in transportation layer. For each RPC, interfaces are exposed, allowing developers to perform custom hooking actions. It's simple and straightforward to implement security mechanisms on top of these infrastructures.
Will support in the future release soon.

It's not a bug. The purpose of doing this is to reduce produce latency.
How does it reduce produce latency? In other words, why reset beginTimeInLock at finally block like release putlock will increase produce latency?
Does your broker 173 use the same name server address after restart? Please check broker.log to verify your broker 173 connects and heartbeats normally to the name server instances.

Yes,Use the same name server address!
The question can also describe by "How to add a new broker?"
When start a new broker,The old topic should update router info include the new broker!

Hi,

Follow the below steps to find the reason:

1. Execute `mqadmin topicStatus`, find the current message offset of the specific topic.
2. Execute `mqadmin consumerProgress`, find the current consumed offset of the specific consumer group.
3. Execute `mqadmin resetOffsetByTime`, watch the result to check whether the new offset is the max offset of the topic.
4. Execute `mqadmin consumerProgress`, watch the new offset.

Collect this command outputs and send an email to our user mailing list for help.

And please respect our issue template for your future reports.
Please provide the detailed log info and send your questions to user or dev mailing lists.
You can execute `mqadmin deleteTopic` command that will update the route info to name server as well.
Any reasonable rationale to modify them?

If it is to compress the body, can we just make a deep clone of the message object and operate on the clone copy thereafter? 

The proposing change attempts to bring in a really **NOT** nice-looking API and I'd, personally, not accept it.

@lindzh

If you are using 4.2.0 or lower version,Please see https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/tree/master/client/src/main/resources for more detail and also https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/master/client/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/client/log/ClientLogger.java. RocketMQ client is using {user.home}/logs/rocketmq_client.log as it's default log file.If you want to change maxLogFileCount and logpath you can set system properties like rocketmq.client.logRoot,rocketmq.client.logFileMaxIndex,rocketmq.client.logLevel. If you want to change other option just overwrite config file.
Offsets are stored in client-side In broadcast mode. If you have any question furthermore, please ask for our user email list. http://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/

i understand the question, i have two question
first question

handleDiskFlush(result, putMessageResult, msg);
handleHA(result, putMessageResult, msg);

if i change the order of  two statement,  master slave flush disk parallelly，
will we  improve performance further?
handleHA(result, putMessageResult, msg);
handleDiskFlush(result, putMessageResult, msg);

second question
with the improve of performance, we will have more  processing threads
the last statement  of  "lock synchronize"   will spend more time

we use 3.2.6 version have 300+ applications,  
the following warning  exceed  20+ everyday

Thanks @qqeasonchen. I will polish here before next release.

This indeed is a distribution issue. As explained in the netty-tcnative project page [here](https://netty.io/wiki/forked-tomcat-native.html), we'd better choose the static linked boring-ssl which contains multiple 64bit native libraries. 

[This commit](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/commit/07b5858ea896155509209bb8ec76f284bcf6f192) resolves this issue.

Thanks @aluomaidi for reporting this issue. I'll look into this issue ASAP. If you have already fixed out how to fix it, you are encouraged to create a pull request and we are happy to discuss your proposing fix.

Yes, it's not safe and should not deploy RocketMQ without applying security protocols. Thankfully, we have already provided transmission tier security enforcement. If you need to deploy your RocketMQ cluster in public network, you're urged to activate 2-way TLS certificate authentication.

If you need fine-grained permission check and control besides transmission encryption, you may implement your own Hook interfaces, say RPCHook interface or SendMessageHook etc. These hooks allow you to enforce checks and validations at various level.
In case you need administrative instructions that set up a secure cluster, you're welcome to write our user mailing list.
I do not see your point... can you elaborate further? It'll be best if you can walk through the code under a conjured scenario to incur the bug.
@aiooly  how to config it .

@xgj1988  you can change the config via broker.conf
```
...
listenPort=11911
...
```
Below code will mix the config
https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/a8ef6d61149457088e55d9c260d7e5d5f5b1dd3a/broker/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/broker/BrokerStartup.java#L125

@pifuant why use a queue to queue threads waiting for a lock can improve the performance？I know that add a queue can take down the race of lock variable CAS. But I cannot understand why this can improve the performance?

@iamzhoug37 
Because the compareAndSet call forces other processors to discard their own cached copies of the lock, so every spinning thread encounters a cache miss almost every time, and must fetch the new, but 
unchanged value.

Using CLH queue, a release thread just wakes up next spinning thread than all.

@xgj1988  为什么不能在配置文件中设置 enablePropertyFilter = true 呢？我的版本也是4.2.0.  我在配置文件中设置enablePropertyFilter=true是生效的。或者你可以在启动的时候使用./mqbroker  enablePropertyFilter=ture. Admin Tool中的UpdateBrokerConfigSubCommand 应该可以动态修改。

@dominicqi  是这样配置撒。。
 在broker.conf里面增加  enablePropertyFilter = true  ，true 应该是大小写都如所谓撒。（应该是broker.conf里面加吧。。中间有空格吧）。其实关键是我看他的源代码，BrokerConfig.java 里面 调用setPropertyFilter地方木有啊（只有 IntegrationTestBase 这里面调用了。）。
@dominicqi 好嘛。。启动的时候要带上 -c ../conf/broker.conf 但是要他的 spring-boot-starter-rocketmq  rocketMQTemplate  不支持 setUserPropertiy 。
@dominicqi  是可以的。。但是就是会自动带上USES_，，放在headers 里面
thank you @pifuant
Hi, you could add `enablePropertyFilter=true` to broker's config file, or you could use tool `mqadmin` to update this property dynamic.

Coverage decreased (-0.02%) to 41.385% when pulling **8ce8a54716391b11ca6958936ba68f8859dfca11 on fuyou001:issues-311** into **c264de9c9345c6526a0f1f16088ffaf0bbefaf12 on apache:develop**.

I understand the purpose of this pull request is to combine topic changes and report them all to nameserver in one registration action. The problem is, each time a new topic is registered, data version of topic config increases and `needRegister` method always returns true, causing active registration immediately, regardless of `forceRegister` being true or false for registerBrokerAll.
It makes sense now.  Good!

Instead of change all topic permission on the broker which is about to be shut down, we suggest changing the permission of the broker itself. That is, `updateBrokerConfig -b IP:port -k brokerPermission -v 4`. In case you changed your mind, you are good to revert broker permission to 6 without affecting individual permission of each single topic.
I'll cose this ticket for now and you may reopen it in case it does not solve your problem in any way, please do not hesitate to reopen it.
@lizhanhui  thx, it's really helpful

I am wondering why notifying clients of membership change could take up the thread pool? Note notify is performed in an asynchronous non-blocking and one-way manner. Can you share your case details justifying this is indeed the root cause?
Nice catch

After reviewing the solution, I find the proposing fix is kind of cumbersome. Can we simply introduce a read-write lock to guard the `mappedFiles` list?  The collection is definitely read-intensive and should not bring about much overhead when guarded with a read-write lock.
